### Rationale

Right now spack limited the number of parallel processes to the number of CPU's.  In fact when used with a caching compiler, much of the build time is i/o bound rather than CPU bound which makes it useful in this case to allow the number of parallel processes to exceed the number of local CPU's.

### Description

spack should allow the user to specify parallel builds that exceed the number of CPU's, as the local machine may be using spack with a compiler server or caching compiler
